task.title:
Week 5: Personal Statement Worksheet 
(30 September 2020)
task.description:
Content: 
Learning objective: Students can practice how to make a personal statement based on mind map and dos and don’ts using personal statement worksheet.

Activities:
1. Counselor gives students the personal statements worksheet.
2. Counselor asks students to try making personal statement based on mind map and do and don’ts 
3. Collaborate with Language teacher to check the grammatical 
4. Fix it after receiving input from the language teacher. Do it over and over again to make them more trained in writing, 
    especially personal statements.

Resources: 
 https://www.thebalancecareers.com/career-choice-or-change-4161891

task.title: REFLECTION
task.description:
Assalamualaikum wr wb 

Hello, Good People! 

Hope this message finds you well! Now, we are heading to the end of semester 1. Please choose your summative assessment or one of your formative assessment in Unit 2 and 3 that you prefer to be part of your portfolio. After choosing it, fill in the attached reflection entry form. Then, when I have given my feedback, you can upload it in your portfolio. 

“Learning is a treasure that will follow its owner everywhere.” — Chinese Proverb

 If you have any further, as usual, just contact me any time. 

Wassalamualaikum wr wb Desy

task.title: Unit 3 Week 1 Effective Communication: Interpersonal Skills (Active Listening)
task.description:
Assalamualaikum wr wb

Hello, Grade 12 students!

Hope this message finds you well! We will learn new theme, EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION!

A dynamic, interconnected and complex world require us to be capable communicators. This unit explores a variety of skills and literacies to broaden students' capabilities as communicators in personal and professional situations and contexts. 

This week, we focus on the topic interpersonal skills, especially in active listening. We will practice how we should demonstrate active listening by using seven norms of collaborations. We also will take a look at the PPS textbook, page 37. By using our smartphones, we will demonstrate several strategies in applying active listening. 

For deeper understanding, let's have answer these burning questions: https://forms.gle/nTrxUsC9AUrBZvBT6 

If you have any inquiries, please free to ask me questions.
Wassalamualaikum wr wb

task.title: Unit 3 Week 7 Summative Assessment
task.description:
Assalamualaikum wr wb

Dear all,
 We have been learning unit 3 about Effective Communication for 6 weeks. We are learning about:
1. Interpersonal skills: Active listening and Non verbal cues
2. Literacy: Digital, media and information literacy skills
3. Self Expression: Presentation and Interview Skills.

Now, it's the culmination for the summative assessment. Integrated with Language and Literature, we will do the role play of an interview as part of the university enrollment process. Please see the attach TSC and you can submit your Language and Literature assessments in this Google Classroom as well.

All the best!

Wassalamualaikum wr wb
Desy

task.title: U3.W5-W6 Summative Assessment
task.description:
Content: Summative assessment

Learning objective: 
Criterion A : (ii). Apply physical and health education knowledge to analyse issues and solve problems set in familiar and unfamiliar situations
Criterion C : (iii). Analyse and apply information to perform effectively

Inquiry questions:
- (Factual) What is a yoga pilates?
- (Conceptual) How can a balance between mind and body be created?
- (Debatable) Does the mind influence the body, and how does the body influence the mind?

Resources: 
5 Olahraga yang Menambah Tinggi Badan https://www.halodoc.com/5-olahraga-yang-menambah-tinggi-badan
Why Is Yoga Becoming So Popular? https://www.huffpost.com/entry/why-is-yoga-becoming-so-p_b_9296612
The Benefits of Yoga https://osteopathic.org/what-is-osteopathic-medicine/benefits-of-yoga/
How often should you practice yoga? https://oneflowyoga.com/blog/how-often-should-you-practice-yoga
Is 20 minutes of yoga enough? https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/is-20-minutes-of-yoga-enough

Books
(Yoga Unit) (Jen Edwards & Britneyy Gese) 
(Sports, Exercise & Health Science) (John Sproule, OXFORD)

task.title: Week 5 [Preparing for Investigation] (13 November 2020)
task.description:
[-] Learning Objective: 
Criterion B (Investigating)
i. formulate a clear and focused research question and justify its relevance 
ii. formulate and follow an action plan to investigate a research question

[-] Success Criteria:
Memahami bahwa kekayaan bukan hanya terkait harta, namun tentang apa yang kita simpan dan tabung untuk kebaikan yang dirasakan di akhirat kelak. Semisal ada uang 50k, 20k untuk makan 20k untuk menabung dan 10k untuk infak ke kotak amal, maka uang yang sesungguhnya yang kita miliki adalah yang 10k karena itu yang akan terus bertahan dan kebaikannya akan kita rasakan di akhirat kelak.

[-] Learning Activity:
- Mengisi google docs tentang investigasi yang sudah disiapkan
- Langsung membuat google form dari google docs yang sudah diisi
- Menyebar google form tersebut
- Menganalisa apa hasil dari google form tersebut, seberapa paham para audience atau masyarakat tentang hakikat harta yang dimiliki. 

[-] ATL Skills:
Thinking skills

[-] IB Learner Profile:
Caring and Thinkers

[-] Inquiry Question:
Bagaimana Islam memandang tentang orang yang banyak harta?
Apakah kaya hanya terfokus pada harta?
Apa hubungan antara Islam, harta dan proses ibadah di dalamnya?
Bagaimana sikap kita seharusnya terhadap harta?

[-] Formative Assessment:
1. Menyusun 10 - 15 research question tentang kekayaan.
2. Membuat action plan: 
(i) Target audience nya siapa dan berapa? Jelaskan alasannya! 
(ii) Cara menyebarkan research question nya bagaimana? Pakai google form kah? IG question kah? atau platform lainnya.
(iii) Jelaskan hipotesis atau perkiraan kesimpulan dari hasil investigating yang dilakukan!

task.title: Week 4 - Review for Written Test
task.description:
Dear students, I will be using this post to give feedback to your understanding of Oxidation state, Redox reaction, voltaic cell and electrolysis do that you can achieve full understanding of the concept and able to solve all the problems during the written test

Determine the oxidation state of these molecules:
1) K2CrO4
2) H2SO3
3) NaClO
4) K2Cr2O7

Identify which part of the reaction is oxidation and which one is reduction
1) NaCl + KNO3 → NaNO3 + KCl 
2) Zn + 2AgCN → 2Ag + Zn(CN)2
3) Pb + PbO2 + 2H2SO4 → 2PbSO4 + 2H2O

From the reactions above, identify the reduction and oxidation agents, oxidation and reduction result

Voltaic Cell 
What is the voltage of a voltaic cell based on this reaction? Is the reaction spontaneous as written?
2 NO3− + 8 H+ + 3 Cu → 2 NO + 4 H2O + 3 Cu2+
Note: 
NO3− + 4 H+ + 3e− → NO + 2 H2O     E1/2 = 0.96 V
Cu2+ + 2 e− → Cu                                 E1/2 = 0.34 V
